Header.forcings: N/A Nat Ant GHG SD SI SA TO SO Oz LU Sl Vl SS Ds BC MD OC AA

ocean_sigma_z.z_factors: sigma: sigma eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev
ocean_sigma_z.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev_bnds
ocean_sigma_z.formula: for k <= nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i) + sigma(k)*(min(depth_c,depth(j,i))+eta(n,j,i)) ; for k > nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = zlev(k)

smooth_level.z_factors: a: a b1: b1 b2: b2 ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2
smooth_level.z_bounds_factors: a: a_bnds b1: b1_bnds b2: b2_bnds ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2

ocean_sigma.z_factors: sigma: lev eta: eta depth: depth
ocean_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth

ocean_s.z_factors: s: lev eta: eta depth: depth a: a_coeff b: b_coeff depth_c: depth_c
ocean_s.z_bounds_factors: s: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth a: a b: b depth_c: depth_c
ocean_s.formula:
z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i)*(1+s(k)) + depth_c*s(k) + (depth(j,i)-depth_c)*C(k) 
 where 
 C(k)=(1-b)*sinh(a*s(k))/sinh(a) +
           b*(tanh(a*(s(k)+0.5))/(2*tanh(0.5*a)) - 0.5)

alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: ap: ap b: b ps: ps
alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ap: ap_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps

standard_sigma.z_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev ps: ps
standard_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev_bnds ps: ps

hybrid_height.z_factors: a: lev b: b orog: orog
hybrid_height.z_bounds_factors: a: lev_bnds b: b_bnds orog: orog

ocean_double_sigma.z_factors: sigma: sigma depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a_coeff href: href k_c: k_c
ocean_double_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a href: href k_c: k_c

standard_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: p0: p0 a: a b: b ps: ps
standard_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: p0: p0 a: a_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps

fLitterSoil.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
fLitterSoil.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cropFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

shrubFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

evspsblveg.comment: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).
evspsblveg.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cProduct.long_name: Carbon Mass in Products of Land Use Change
cProduct.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

treeFracSecDec.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary deciduous trees.
treeFracSecDec.long_name: Total Secondary Deciduous Tree Cover Fraction

fGrazing.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Grazing on Land
fGrazing.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

mrfso.comment: the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.
mrfso.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cLeaf.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

fHarvest.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Crop Harvesting
fHarvest.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cLitterAbove.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

rh.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land
rh.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cSoilMedium.comment: medium is meant as lifetime of more than than 10 years and less than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations)
cSoilMedium.long_name: Carbon Mass in Medium Soil Pool
cSoilMedium.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

nppWood.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP
nppWood.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Wood
nppWood.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

fFire.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
fFire.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO2 Emission from Fire
fFire.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

baresoilFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

prveg.comment: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.
prveg.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cVeg.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cRoot.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cSoilFast.comment: fast is meant as lifetime of less than 10 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations).
cSoilFast.long_name: Carbon Mass in Fast Soil Pool
cSoilFast.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

grassFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

ra.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land
ra.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

mrsos.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.
mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
mrsos.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

npp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land
npp.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cCwd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
cCwd.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

gpp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land
gpp.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

fLuc.comment: human changes to land (excluding forest regrowth) accounting possibly for different time-scales related to fate of the wood, for example.
fLuc.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change
fLuc.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

nep.comment: Natural flux of CO2 (expressed as a mass flux of carbon) from the atmosphere to the land calculated as the difference between uptake associated will photosynthesis and the release of CO2 from the sum of plant and soil respiration and fire.  Positive flux is into the land.  emissions from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
nep.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmophere due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land.
nep.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

treeFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

evspsblsoi.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

nbp.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.
nbp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
nbp.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

lai.comment: a ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
lai.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

mrso.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.
mrso.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

burntArea.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by burnt vegetation.

cSoilSlow.comment: fast is meant as lifetime of more than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations)
cSoilSlow.long_name: Carbon Mass in Slow Soil Pool
cSoilSlow.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

mrros.comment: the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
mrros.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cLitter.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cMisc.long_name: Carbon Mass in Other Living Compartments on Land
cMisc.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

tsl.comment: 'Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as ''missing'' for grid cells occupied entirely by ''sea''.'

cSoil.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

fVegLitter.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
fVegLitter.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

treeFracPrimDec.comment: 'This is the fraction of the entire grid cell  that is covered by ''total primary deciduous trees.'''

treeFracPrimEver.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by primary evergreen trees.
treeFracPrimEver.long_name: Total Primary Evergreen Tree Cover Fraction

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

pastureFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.

cWood.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

rGrowth.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Growth Autotrophic Respiration on Land
rGrowth.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

cLitterBelow.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

tran.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

mrro.comment: 'the total runoff (including ''drainage'' through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.'
mrro.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

nppRoot.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP
nppRoot.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Roots
nppRoot.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

rMaint.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Maintenance Autotrophic Respiration on Land
rMaint.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

treeFracSecEver.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary evergreen trees.
treeFracSecEver.long_name: Total Secondary Evergreen Tree Cover Fraction

nppLeaf.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP
nppLeaf.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Leaf
nppLeaf.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

residualFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by ''non-vegetation'' and ''non-bare-soil'' (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
residualFrac.long_name: Fraction of Grid Cell that is Land but Neither Vegetation-Covered nor Bare Soil

c3PftFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).

mrlsl.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as ''missing'' for grid cells occupied entirely by ''sea''
mrlsl.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land

c4PftFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).

landCoverFrac.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.

fVegSoil.comment: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
fVegSoil.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
fVegSoil.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land
